page.title: 05ASTWOOD BANK,TYPES OF HOUSES
page.content: One of the oldest houses in Astwood Bank is a Pre-Georgian house at the crossroads,on Evesham Road.There is a pillar either side of the door.There are a few Victorian houses down Feckenham Road.The ages of the houses range from Pre-Georgian to Post 1945.The Methodist Church is probably the oldest church.Ridgeway Middle School was built as a secondary school in 1958.It was officially opened in 1959.Most of the houses around the school are from 1900 to Post 1945.There are no black and white houses in Astwood Bank.Castle Street is mainly new housing estate-type buildings.They have wood panels on the outside and tiles around.The houses down Feckenham Road are Victorian.They are small brick houses with an overhanging porch.The Astwood Bank Primary School is Victorian.
